title: Missing Archive Items
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for over 5 years. I am presently using version 128.11.1esr and I update it often. Many e-mails have been put into an "Archive" folder but I just noticed that all of the items put there are now gone. The "Archive" folder is empty. The account that this is attached to is AOL, xxx@verizon.net.

Are there any thoughts on how this could have happened? I am hoping I can get the items back.

Thanks for your thoughts, Steve H.

creator: donamy5475

title: Thunderbird folder did not load, emails downloaded by POP3 now seemingly lost
content:
Having opened Thunderbird a message came up to the effect that the folder had not loaded. No emails were shown in the list, although the total number of emails in the folder appeared as usual above the list.

Thunderbird then downloaded over 100 emails, according to the status bar. These messages were previously present on the server, and were downloaded via POP3 with the option to delete on the server once downloaded selected.

Having closed Thunderbird and relaunched, the folder with all the existing emails appeared. However, there are no emails now on the server, this having been verified by logging in to webmail.

Where have the emails gone?

If they are indeed lost then why does Thunderbird proceed with downloading messages when a folder has not loaded? Why is downloading of messages not conditional on the folder having loaded? This would avoid such an eventuality.

I am running Thunderbird 115.18.0 32-bit in Windows 7 SP1 64-bit.
creator: DonnyDave

title: Address book not working properly
content: Address book not working properly, Add to address book gets stuck, will NOT add. SOMETIMES reboot thunderbird resets BUT not always.
creator: don.burroughs

title: Thunderbird compact fails
content: Compacting fails with error message " The folder 'Inbox on **********' could not be compacted because writing to folder failed. Verify that you have enough disk space, and that you have write privileges to the file system, then try again." This happens on both my PC's, which are not connected in any way, but have duplicate installations. The profile is 7.75GB - PC A - Win 10 Pro - has 704GB spare disk space, PC B - Win 11 Pro - has 50GB spare disk space. I can think of no reason why write permissons would change. This problem started with ver. 138 & has continued with ver. 139
creator: spsware

title: Moved an accidentally deleted mail and now I can't find it.
content: Hiya. I had a message that I accidentally deleted by force-of-habit. I found it in Bin and selected Move To/Favourites/Inbox. It's now disappeared and doesn't show in the search. It's not present on my Gmail account either. Is there any way to get this back?

title: Printing and print preview not working (endless spinning wheel)
content:
Whenever I want to print an email the print preview doesn't show, it keeps displaying a spinning wheel. Printing also doesn't work (as in, I press Save, enter a filename and press Save; the dialog closes but no file is generated).

I already tried the Troubleshooting information -> Clear saved print settings, but to no avail.

Browser console screenshot attached. I'm using Fedora 41 and Thunderbird 128.11.0esr (flatpak).
creator: Dodo
